imt: she woman.\textsc{def} she became yes totally nerd then
src: \textbf{Hun} \textbf{dama} hun blei jo helt nerd da.
trs: But that woman became a total nerd, as you know.’\footnote{In both \REF{ex:johannessen:4} and \REF{ex:johannessen:5}, the pronoun after the initial noun phrase shows that the initial noun phrase is left-dislocated. Left-dislocation is very common in speech, and is generally used to lift something into focus \citep[904–908]{FaarlundEtAl1997}.}
